wa-sectionHero wa-sectionHero-pricing"> <div class="wa-content wa-content-4up"> <h1>Virtual Machines Pricing</h1> <div class="wa-spacer wa-spacer-3down"> <h3>Launch Windows Server and Linux in minutes</h3> <a data-event-property="virtual-machines top CTA" data-event="pricingdetails-clicked-primarycta" href="/en-us/trial/free-trial-virtual-machines/" class="wa-button wa-button-primary">Try for free</a> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-content-micro wa-content-4up"> <div class="wa-spacer"> <a href="/en-us/services/virtual-machines/" class="wa-arrowLink wa-arrowLink-light">Virtual Machines Overview</a> </div> <div class="wa-spacer"> <a href="/en-us/documentation/services/virtual-machines/" class="wa-arrowLink wa-arrowLink-light">Documentation</a> </div> <span class="icon icon-l"><svg><use xlink:href="#virtual-machines" viewBox="0 0 50 50"/></svg></span> </div> </section> <section class="wa-section wa-section-mini wa-section-W06"> <div class="wa-content wa-content-4up"> <h2>How Azure pricing works</h2> <div class="wa-spacer"> <ul class="wa-checkList wa-checkList- wa-checkList-green-white"> <li><strong>No</strong> upfront cost</li> </ul> </div> <div class="wa-spacer"> <ul class="wa-checkList wa-checkList wa-checkList-green-white"> <li><strong>No</strong> termination fees</li> </ul> </div> <div class="wa-spacer"> <ul class="wa-checkList wa-checkList wa-checkList-green-white"> <li>Pay only for what you use</li> </ul> </div> <div class="wa-spacer"> <ul class="wa-checkList wa-checkList wa-checkList-green-white"> <li>Per minute billing</li> </ul> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-content-micro wa-content-divided"> <a href="/en-us/pricing/" class="wa-arrowLink wa-arrowLink-light">Learn more about Azure pricing</a> </div> </section> <section class="wa-section"> <div class="wa-content"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>Earn discounts on Azure services with a prepaid 12-month subscription. <a href="/en-us/offers/ms-azr-0026p/">Learn more</a>.</p> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <p>We support a wide variety of virtual machine sizes. Virtual machines are billed on per-minute basis.</p><p>Virtual Machines are supported in both a Basic and Standard tier. The Basic tier provides an economical option for dev/test workloads, and other applications that don’t require load-balancing, auto-scaling, or memory-intensive virtual machines. The Standard tier is our recommended option for all production workloads.</p> <ul class="wa-tabs wa-tabsBlock" data-control="tabs" data-tab-panel="tab-panel-os"> <li><a href="#" class="wa-tab active" Monthly Pay-As-You-Go estimates based on 744 hours of continuous use. <span class="wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="australia-east australia-southeast"> The Australia Regions are available to customers with a business presence in Australia or New Zealand. </span> </caption> </table> <h3>Optimized compute: 60% faster than A-series*, more memory, and local SSD</h3> <p>D-series virtual machines feature solid state drives (SSDs) and 60% faster processors than the A-series and are also available for web or worker roles in Azure Cloud Services. This series is ideal for applications that demand faster CPUs, better local disk performance, or higher memories.</p> <p>We have a new variant of the D-series sizes called “DS” that are specifically targeted for Premium Storage. The pricing and billing meters for the DS sizes are the same as D-series. SSD storage included in D-series VMs is local temporary storage. For persistent storage, use DS VMs instead and purchase Premium Storage separately.</p> <p class="wa-footNote">* Relative to the A1-A7 VM sizes. A8-A11 sizes are faster than D-series.</p> <div class="wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="us-east us-west us-north-central us-south-central europe-north europe-west asia-pacific-southeast Dv2-series instances will carry more powerful CPUs which are on average about 35% faster than D-series instances, and carry the same memory and disk configurations as the D-series. Dv2-series instances are based on the latest generation 2.4 GHz Intel Xeon® E5-2673 v3 (Haswell) processor, and with Intel Turbo Boost Technology 2.0 can go to 3.2 GHz. Dv2-series and D-series are ideal for applications that demand faster CPUs, better local disk performance, or higher memories and offer a powerful combination for many enterprise-grade applications.</p> <div class="wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="us-east us-west us-north-central us-south-central europe-north europe-west asia-pacific-southeast asia-pacific-east Please select another region.</p> </div> </div> <br/> <h3>Performance optimized compute: unparalleled computational performance with latest CPUs, more memory, and more local SSD</h3> <p>G-series virtual machines feature latest <a href="http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=692100" target="_blank">Intel® Xeon® processor E5 v3 family</a>, two times more memory and four times more Solid State Drive storage (SSDs) than the D-series. G-series will provide unparalleled computational performance, more memory and more local SSD storage than any current VM size in the public cloud making it very ideal for your most demanding applications.</p> <p>We have a new variant of the G-series sizes called “GS” that are specifically targeted for Premium Storage. The pricing and billing meters for the GS sizes are the same as G-series. SSD storage included in G-series VMs is local temporary storage. For persistent storage, use GS VMs instead and purchase Premium Storage separately.</p> <p>G5 instance is isolated to hardware dedicated to a single customer.</p> <div class="wa-conditionalDisplay" GB is represented using 1024^3 bytes sometimes referred to as Gibibyte, or base 2 definition. When comparing sizes that use different base systems, remember that base 2 sizes may appear smaller than base 10 but for any specific size, a base 2 system provides more capacity than a base 10 system, because 1024^3 is greater than 1000^3 <span class="wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="australia-east australia-southeast"> The Australia Regions are available to customers with a business presence in Australia or New Zealand. </span> </caption> </table> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="us-east"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>G-series is not available in the East US region. A8 and A9 virtual machines feature <a href="http://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/processors/xeon/xeon-processor-e5-family.html" target="_blank">Intel® Xeon® E5 processors</a>. Adds a 32 Gbit/s InfiniBand network with remote direct memory access (RDMA) technology. Ideal for Message Passing Interface (MPI) applications, high-performance clusters, modeling and simulations, video encoding, and other compute or network intensive scenarios.</p> <div> <div Our customers can run their business critical Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) applications and workloads on Microsoft Azure. </p> <p><a href="/en-us/campaigns/redhat/">Learn more about Microsoft and Red Hat partnership</a>.</p> <p>We provide the following options to deploy RHEL images:</p> <h3>On-Demand RHEL images</h3> <p>The following price options are available for RHEL images on Azure Virtual Machines:</p> <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Number of Virtual Cores</th> <th>RHEL Price</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>Virtual machines with up to 4 cores</td> <td> <span class="price-data " data-amount='0.06'>$0.06</span>/hr </td> </tr> <tr> <td>Virtual machines with more than 4 cores</td> <td> <span class="price-data " data-amount='0.13'>$0.13</span>/hr </td> </tr> </tbody> <caption> <p>The above mentioned prices are for RHEL images and do not include the cost of the VM. Customers can use <a href="https://access.redhat.com/articles/migrating-to-red-hat-cloud-access">Red Hat Cloud Access</a> to move their Red Hat Subscription to Microsoft Azure.</p> </div> </div> <div> customers with a business presence in Australia or New Zealand. </span> </caption> </table> <h3>Optimized compute: 60% faster than A-series, more memory, and local SSD</h3> <p>D-series virtual machines feature solid state drives (SSDs) and faster processors than the A-series and are also available for web or worker roles in Azure Cloud Services. This series is ideal for applications that demand faster CPUs, better local disk performance, or higher memories.</p> <p>We have a new variant of the D-series sizes called “DS” that are specifically targeted for Premium Storage. The pricing and billing meters for the DS sizes are the same as D-series. SSD storage included in D-series VMs is local temporary storage. For persistent storage, use DS VMs instead and purchase Premium Storage separately.</p> <div class="wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="us-east us-west us-north-central us-south-central <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>For Azure Government pricing information, contact your Microsoft representative or reseller.</p> </div> </div> <br/> <h3>Optimized compute: 35% faster than D-series, latest generation of CPU</h3> <p>Dv2-series instances are the next generation of D-series instances that can be used as Virtual Machines or Cloud Services. Dv2-series instances will carry more powerful CPUs which are on average about 35% faster than D-series instances, and carry the same memory and disk configurations as the D-series. Dv2-series instances are based on the latest generation 2.4 GHz Intel Xeon® E5-2673 v3 (Haswell) processor, and with Intel Turbo Boost Technology 2.0 can go to 3.2 GHz. Dv2-series and D-series are ideal for applications that demand faster CPUs, better local disk performance, or higher memories and offer a powerful combination for many enterprise-grade applications.</p> <div class="wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="us-east us-west us-north-central us-south-central europe-north europe-west asia-pacific-southeast asia-pacific-east class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>Dv2-series is not available in the Japan West region. Please select another region.</p> </div> </div> <br/> <h3>Performance optimized compute: unparalleled computational performance with latest CPUs, more memory, and more local SSD</h3> <p>G-series virtual machines feature latest <a href="http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=692100" target="_blank">Intel® Xeon® processor E5 v3 family</a>, two times more memory and four times more Solid State Drive storage (SSDs) than the D-series. G-series will provide unparalleled computational performance, more memory and more local SSD storage than any current VM size in the public cloud making it very ideal for your most demanding applications.</p> <p>We have a new variant of the G-series sizes called “GS” that are specifically targeted for Premium Storage. The pricing and billing meters for the GS sizes are the same as G-series. SSD storage included in G-series VMs is local temporary storage. For persistent storage, use GS VMs instead and purchase Premium Storage separately.</p> <p>G5 instance is isolated to hardware dedicated to a single customer.</p> <div class="wa-conditionalDisplay" <caption> GB is represented using 1024^3 bytes sometimes referred to as Gibibyte, or base 2 definition. When comparing sizes that use different base systems, remember that base 2 sizes may appear smaller than base 10 but for any specific size, a base 2 system provides more capacity than a base 10 system, because 1024^3 is greater than 1000^3 <span class="wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="australia-east australia-southeast"> The Australia Regions are available to customers with a business presence in Australia or New Zealand. </span> </caption> </table> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="us-east"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>G-series is not available in the East US region. Please select another region.</p> <p>G-series virtual machines are currently only available in West US, East US 2, West Europe, and Southeast Asia regions.</p> </div> </div> <br/> <h3>Network optimized: fast networking with InfiniBand support</h3> <p>Available in select data centers. A8 and A9 virtual machines feature <a href="http://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/processors/xeon/xeon-processor-e5-family.html" target="_blank">Intel® Xeon® E5 processors</a>. Adds a 32 Gbit/s InfiniBand network with remote direct memory access (RDMA) technology. Ideal for Message Passing Interface (MPI) applications, high-performance clusters, modeling and simulations, video encoding, and other compute or network intensive scenarios.</p> <div> <div In some cases, it’s provided by the publisher for free. In other cases, we charge by the minute for the right to receive support. The total charge for running a Linux VM is the support rate (if applicable) plus the Linux compute rate. Microsoft does not provide support for Linux images in the Azure Marketplace.</p> <p>Free trial, MSDN, BizSpark, and Microsoft Partner Network member benefits (monetary credits) don’t apply to publisher provided Linux support, which is billed separately. However, if you are on a 6 or 12-Month Purchase Plan or the 12-Month Commitment Offer, your commitment balance can be used for Linux support charges until June 30, 2016. Afterwards, license charges for the support provided by Linux publishers will be billed separately and won’t be discounted (consistent with all third-party products). Linux support charges are billed separately for Enterprise Agreement customers and are not deducted from prepaid monetary commitment (consistent with all third-party products).</p> <h3>SUSE Linux Enterprise Server (SLES) images</h3> <p>Azure Virtual Machines can be deployed from SLES Basic and SLES Premium images available in the Azure Marketplace. Customers who deploy SLES Basic images are entitled to receive patching from SUSE for those VMs at no additional charge over the compute rates. Customers who deploy SLES Premium images are entitled to receive both patching and telephone and email support from SUSE for those VMs at the support rates listed below. These prices apply to both Basic and Standard VM instance sizes.</p> <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Applicable VM instance</th> <th class="numeric align-c">Number Of Virtual Cores</th> <th>SLES Premium</th> Australia or New Zealand. </span> </caption> </table> <p>As mentioned above in the Linux Support description, support for publisher provided Linux support is not discounted (consistent with 3rd party products) and does not reduce prepaid monetary commitment, and is billed separately for Enterprise Agreement customers.</p> <h3>Canonical Ubuntu Server Linux images</h3> <p>Customers who deploy VMs from Canonical Ubuntu Server Linux images available in the Azure Marketplace are entitled to receive patching from Canonical for those VMs at no additional charge over the compute rates.</p> <h3>OpenLogic CentOS-Based Linux Images</h3> <p>Customers who deploy VMs from OpenLogic CentOS-based Linux images available in the Azure Marketplace will be entitled to receive patching from OpenLogic for those VMs at no additional charge over the compute rates.</p> </div> <div> <p>The prices below apply to all versions of SQL Server. Per-minute rates for SQL Server images don’t include the cost of the Windows Server virtual machine it runs on. <a href="#Windows" data-tab-id="1" data-tab-panel="tab-panel-os">See the Windows Server rates.</a>.</p> <p><a href="https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/cc645993.aspx">Learn more</a> about features supported by the different editions of SQL Server 2014. We recommend at least Standard DS3 for SQL Enterprise (same price as D3) and Standard DS2 (same price as D2) for SQL Standard.</p> <h3>SQL Server for A-series Virtual Machines</h3> <table> <thead> Please select another region.</p> <p>G-series virtual machines are currently only available in West US, East US 2, West Europe, and Southeast Asia regions.</p> </div> </div> </div> <div> <p>You need a license to run SharePoint Server on Azure. See the <a href="http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=624378">License Mobility for Software Assurance</a> or <a href="http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/cloudandhosting">Services Provider License Agreement</a> sites for more details. We charge only for the Windows Server VMs that SharePoint Server 2013 runs on. <a href="#Windows" data-tab-id="1" data-tab-panel="tab-panel-os">See the Windows Server rates.</a></p> <p> Learn more about <a href="https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn275958.aspx">setting up SharePoint Server on Azure</a>.</p> </div> <div> <p>The Azure Marketplace offers several options for deploying Oracle software on a Virtual Machine (VM). Pricing depends on the option you choose.</p> <h3>License-included VMs</h3> <p>License-included Oracle virtual machines are Windows Server VMs with Oracle software preinstalled. The license for these VMs is provided by Microsoft Open Technologies, Inc. (MS Open Tech), a subsidiary of Microsoft Corp., under agreement with Oracle. When you choose this option, we charge separately for the Oracle software and the Windows Server virtual machines it runs on. The hourly rates shown here are just for the Oracle software license and don’t include the cost of underlying Windows Server VMs. We bill for virtual machines by the minute.</p> <p>Free trial, MSDN, BizSpark, and Microsoft Partner Network member benefits (monetary credits) don’t apply to license-included Oracle images, which are billed separately. However, if you are on a 6 or 12-Month Purchase Plan or the 12-Month Commitment Offer, your commitment balance can be used for Oracle license charges until June 30, 2016. Afterwards, license charges for the Oracle software will be billed separately and won’t be discounted (consistent with all third-party products). Oracle license charges are billed separately for Enterprise Agreement customers and are not deducted from prepaid monetary commitment (consistent with all third-party products).</p> <h3>Oracle use an image that contains a combination of Oracle software, we’ll charge you for the combined rate. For example, the hourly cost of Oracle WebLogic Server (Enterprise Edition) and Oracle Database (Enterprise Edition) on a 1-core virtual machine is <span class="price-data " data-amount='3.8'>$3.8</span> USD (<span class="price-data " data-amount='1.28'>$1.28</span> + <span class="price-data " data-amount='2.52'>$2.52</span>).</p> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="us-east"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>G-series is not available in the East US region. Please select another region.</p> <p>G-series virtual machines are currently only available in West US, East US 2, West Europe, and Southeast Asia regions.</p> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="australia-southeast"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>G-series is not available in the Australia Southeast region. Please select another region.</p> <p>G-series virtual machines are currently only available in West US, East US 2, West Europe, and Southeast Asia regions.</p> </div> </div> <br/> <h3>Bring-Your-Own-License VMs</h3> <p>Another option in the Azure Marketplace is Bring-Your-Own-License (BYOL) Oracle images, which are Oracle Linux VMs with Oracle software preinstalled.</p> <p>BYOL Oracle images don’t include a license. If you deploy a BYOL Oracle image, you must have obtained license rights from Oracle or its authorized distributor. We charge only for the BYOL Linux VMs that the Oracle software runs on, not for the Oracle software itself (see pricing details under the "Linux" tab), so the prices shown here don’t apply.</p> <h3>Oracle License Mobility Policy</h3> <p>The prices shown here also don’t apply to Oracle software you install on any virtual machine under the Oracle License Mobility program. Oracle provides license mobility for customers who have already obtained a license from Oracle and want to run that software on Azure. To take advantage of this program, simply deploy a Windows Server or Linux VM and install your licensed Oracle software. For information, see the <a href="http://www.oracle.com/us/corporate/pricing/cloud-licensing-070579.pdf">Oracle Cloud Licensing Policy</a>.</p> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="us-east us-west us-north-central us-south-central europe-north europe-west asia-pacific-southeast asia-pacific-east japan-east japan-west brazil-south us-east-2 us-central australia-east australia-southeast"> <h3>IP address options</h3> <p>Every Cloud Service containing one or more Azure Virtual Machines is automatically assigned a free dynamic Virtual IP (VIP) address. For an additional charge, you can also get:</p> <ul> <li><strong>Instance-level Public IP Addresses:</strong> A dynamic Public IP Address (PIP) that is assigned to a Virtual Machine for direct access.</li> <li><strong>Reserved IP Addresses:</strong> A public IP address that can be reserved for your subscription, which can be used as a VIP address for any cloud service in the region.</li> <li><strong>Load Balanced IP Addresses:</strong> Additional load balanced VIP addresses that can be assigned to a Cloud Service containing one or more Azure Virtual Machines.</li> </ul> <p><a href="/en-us/pricing/details/ip-addresses/" class="wa-arrowLink wa-arrowLink-blue">See IP address pricing</a></p> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="central-india west-india south-india"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>The India regions are currently available to volume licensing customers and partners with a local enrollment in India. For more information, contact your Microsoft India partner manager or account manager. The India regions will open to direct online Azure subscriptions in 2016.</p> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="usgov-virginia"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>For Azure Government pricing information, contact your Microsoft representative or reseller.</p> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="usgov-iowa"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>For Azure Government pricing information, contact your Microsoft representative or reseller.</p> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay"> <h3>Support &amp; SLA</h3> <ul> <li>Free billing and subscription management support</li> <li>Flexible support plans starting at <span class="price-data " data-amount='{"currencies":{"ARS":450.0,"AUD":40.0,"BRL":110.0,"CAD":40.0,"CHF":30.0,"DKK":200.0,"EUR":25.0,"GBP":20.0,"HKD":250.0,"IDR":430000.0,"INR":1800.0,"JPY":3000.0,"KRW":34800.0,"MXN":600.0,"MYR":150.0,"NOK":250.0,"NZD":40.0,"RUB":1900.0,"SAR":110.0,"SEK":250.0,"TRY":90.0,"TWD":900.0,"USD":29.0,"ZAR":500.0}}' data-decimals="0">$29</span>/month (Note: Microsoft support does not include support for Linux images in the Azure Marketplace, though in some cases Linux publishers offer support per the plans above). <a href="/en-us/support/plans/">Find a plan</a></li> <li>Guaranteed 99.95% connectivity for multiple instances. <a href="/en-us/support/legal/sla/virtual-machines/">Read the SLA</a></li> </ul> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <div class="wa-faq-expandAll" data-faq="faq"> <a href="#" class="expand">Expand All</a> <a href="#" class="collapse">Collapse All</a> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-content-micro"> <h2>FAQ</h2> <h3>General</h3> <ul class="wa-faq" data-faq="faq"> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">Am I billed separately for local disk storage?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>No. All new virtual machines have an operating system disk and a local disk (or “resource disk”). We don’t charge for local disk storage. The operating system disk is charged at the regular rate for disks. <a href="https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn197896.aspx">See all virtual machines configurations</a></p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">If my deployed instance says &quot;stopped,” am I still getting billed?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Maybe. If the status says “Stopped (Deallocated),” you’re not being billed. If it says “Stopped Allocated,” you’re still being billed for allocated virtual cores (not the software license itself). Full details on VM states are available <a href="https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn763934.aspx">here</a>.</p> <table> <thead> <tr> <th>State</th> <th>Billed</th> <th>Details</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>Starting</td> <td>Yes</td> <td>The initial starting state of VMs as they are going through the boot cycle. This period is billed as the VMs are running.</td> </tr> <tr> <td>Running (Started)</td> <td>Yes</td> <td>The running state of the VM.</td> </tr> <tr> <td>Stopped</td> <td>Yes</td> <td><p>You are billed for Allocated cores, but not software license.</p><p>Note: To put a VM in “Stopped” status, use the power option within the VM, not from the Microsoft Azure classic portal.</p> </td> </tr> <tr> <td>Stopped (Deallocated)</td> <td>No</td> <td><p>Cores are no longer allocated to the VM, and are no longer billed.</p><p>Note: To put a VM in “Stopped (Deallocated)” status, use the “Shutdown” option from the Microsoft Azure classic portal.</p> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">Does the virtual machine instance price include storage costs associated with the running image?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>No, it doesn’t.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">If my virtual machine ran for less than an hour, how much do I get billed?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>We charge for the number of minutes your virtual machine is running, rounded to the nearest minute, not hour.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">What is internal load balancing?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>It’s a new preview feature for Azure Virtual Machines with private IP addresses. The internally load balanced endpoint is only accessible within a virtual network (for VMs within a VNET) or cloud service (for VMs outside a VNET). Internal load balancing is useful for multi-tier applications where some of the application tiers aren’t public facing yet require load balancing functionality.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">How can I check that I have properly stopped a VM and that I am not being billed for it?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>You can check the status of your virtual machines in the Virtual Machines tab and also in the VM Dashboard. If VM status says "Stopped," you’re still being billed. Only "Stopped (Deallocated)" indicates you’re not billed.</p> <p>To ensure you’re not being billed, always stop virtual machines from the management portal. You can also stop the VM through Powershell by calling ShutdownRoleOperation with "PostShutdownAction" equal to "StoppedDeallocated".</p> <p>If you shut down a VM from inside ( using Windows power options) or through PowerShell by calling ShutdownRoleOperation with "PostShutdownAction" equal to "Stopped".</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">If I have instances in two different regions, how am I charged for data transfers?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Each instance is charged for its data egress across regions.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">Is tax included in the pricing above?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>No. Tax will be added separately.</p> </div> </li> </ul> <h3>Windows Server</h3> <ul class="wa-faq" data-faq="faq"> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">If I upload my on-premises Windows Server image to Azure, do I need to provide my license keys?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>No. Microsoft provides the Windows Server license keys for any running instances.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">If I download an Azure Windows Server image to my datacenter, is the license transferrable?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>No. You’ll need to supply a license for the image.</p> </div> </li> </ul> <h3>Red Hat Linux</h3> <ul class="wa-faq" data-faq="faq"> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">Do the RHEL prices stated above include VM prices?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>No. The prices mention in the RHEL section are incremental to the VM prices mentioned in our <a href="/en-us/pricing/details/virtual-machines/#Linux">Linux VM rates</a>.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">How can I use my existing RHEL subscription on Azure?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Customers can use <a href="https://access.redhat.com/articles/migrating-to-red-hat-cloud-access">Red Hat Cloud Access</a> to move their Red Hat Subscription to Microsoft Azure.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">Are RHEL images available in all Azure regions?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Yes.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">What is the total cost of RHEL VM?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Total RHEL VM price consist of the two components: base compute price + RHEL image price. For example, for Standard D1 VM base price is <span class="price-data " data-amount='0.067'>$0.067</span>, RHEL VM image price for VMs up to 4 cores is <span class="price-data " data-amount='0.06'>$0.06</span>, so the total cost of D1 RHEL VM will be <span class="price-data " data-amount='0.067'>$0.067</span> + <span class="price-data " data-amount='0.06'>$0.06</span> = <span class="price-data " data-amount='0.127'>$0.127</span>. Note: the price shown in the portal UI provisioning flow does not include RHEL image price in it.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">Can I use my 30-day free trial credits to provision RHEL images?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>No. If you want to use RHEL software during your trial, you need to <a href="https://account.windowsazure.com/Subscriptions">remove the spending limit on it</a> and add a credit card to your subscription. Otherwise you'll hit your spending limit and your subscription will be disabled.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">Can I use my MSDN, BizSpark, or MPN credits to pay for RHEL images?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>No, these Azure credits don't apply to third-party software such as RHEL. To use RHEL image you'll need to <a href="https://account.windowsazure.com/Subscriptions">remove the spending limit</a> and add a credit card to your subscription. Your existing credits would be applied to the base compute price of these VMs (only the RHEL image price will be charged against your credit card). Otherwise you'll hit your spending limit and your subscription will be immediately disabled.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">My subscription got disabled because I provisioned a RHEL VM without removing the spending limit. How do I re-enable it?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>When subscription is disabled all VMs are automatically stopped. To re-enable the subscription, you'll need to <a href="https://account.windowsazure.com/Subscriptions">remove the spending limit</a> and add a credit card to your subscription. Your existing credits for the current billing cycle would be restored, however, charges for third party software such as RHEL would go against your credit card if you choose to continue running it. You will need to restart all stopped VMs on your subscription manually.</p> </div> </li> </ul> <h3>Oracle Software</h3> <ul class="wa-faq" data-faq="faq"> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">Can I use my 30-day free trial credits to purchase Oracle software?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>No, you can’t. If you want to use Oracle software during your trial, you need to turn off the default <span class="price-data " data-amount='0.0'>$0</span> <a href="/en-us/pricing/spending-limits/">spending limit feature</a> and pay regular pay-as-you-go rates. <strong>Otherwise you’ll hit your spending limit and your subscription will be immediately disabled</strong>.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">Can I use my MSDN, Bizspark, or MPN credits to pay for Oracle software?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>No, these Azure credits don’t apply. To buy Oracle software, you’ll need to turn off the default <span class="price-data " data-amount='0.0'>$0</span> <a href="/en-us/pricing/spending-limits/">spending limit feature</a> and pay regular pay-as-you-go rates. <strong>Otherwise, you’ll hit your spending limit and your subscription will be immediately disabled</strong>.</p> </div> </li> </ul> <h3>SQL Server</h3> <ul class="wa-faq" data-faq="faq"> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">When would I use Azure SQL database vs. SQL Server?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>If you have existing applications or workloads you simply want to grab and move to the cloud or extend parts of on-premises application to the cloud, SQL Server in a Virtual Machine is the easiest option. If you’re looking to build new relational applications, SQL Database is probably the best long-term solution. Either way, Azure makes it easy to move applications back and forth between an on-site datacenter and the cloud as business needs change.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">Which edition of SQL Server 2014 should I pick?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>To help you choose, <a href="https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/cc645993.aspx">here’s a detailed feature comparison</a>.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">What&#39;s different about the data warehousing edition of SQL Server enterprise?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Data warehousing is typically a complex workload to setup, configure, and tune. The specially optimized data warehouse image for Azure Virtual Machines improves performance for these workloads by as much as 20 percent over the regular SQL Server Enterprise virtual machine image. <a href="https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn387396.aspx">How it works</a></p> </div> </li> </ul> <h3>SharePoint</h3> <ul class="wa-faq" data-faq="faq"> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">I already have a SharePoint license. Can I use it for Azure?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>It depends. You can use your license if you meet the requirements for <a href="http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=624378">License Mobility through Software Assurance</a>, or have a <a href="http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=626646">Services Provider License Agreement (SPLA)</a>.</p> </div> </li> </ul> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <p><a href="/en-us/pricing/licensing-faq/">See more FAQs on virtual machine licensing</a></p> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <h3>Resources</h3> <div class="wa-resourceBlockRow"> <a href="/en-us/pricing/calculator/" class="wa-resourceBlock"> <span class="wa-resourceBlock-header">Calculator</span> Estimate your monthly costs for Azure services </a> <a href="/en-us/pricing/faq/" class="wa-resourceBlock"> <span class="wa-resourceBlock-header">Purchase FAQ</span> Review Azure pricing frequently asked questions </a> <a href="/en-us/services/virtual-machines/" class="wa-resourceBlock"> <span class="wa-resourceBlock-header">Service Details</span> Learn more about Virtual Machines </a> <a href="/en-us/documentation/services/virtual-machines/" class="wa-resourceBlock"> <span class="wa-resourceBlock-header">Documentation</span> Review technical tutorials, videos and more resources </a> </div> </div> </section> <section class="wa-section
